titleStmt.title: A Deduction wherein is proved by most clear arguments that the right of devolution hath no place among soveraign princes of the lovv countreys, as some have gone about to perswade and that the delay of paying the French queen's dowry does not annull the renunciation whish [sic] she made at her marriage.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Bodleian Library.
